intro: Luzula acuminata subsp. acuminata, commonly known as the acutely pointed wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and dense clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish or brownish flowers in a spike-like inflorescence, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Luzula acuminata subsp. acuminata is often found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
